title: Adjunct Faculty Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brooklyn College (Brooklyn, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Informal interview conducted with department head. Asked to speak on previous courses taught at other institutions in the past. If you havent taught in the past, you have to take pedagogy course, shadow a professor, and conduct a brief interview following completion of the class.
Interview Questions: What is your experience teaching at post secondary institutions?

title: Plumber Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brooklyn College
Interview Descriptions: Very difficult. I had to write a review in order to access the content. I kinda made it up and they let me through. One time I wrote an honest review and they deleted it. Not sure why.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work here?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brooklyn College
Interview Descriptions: First round required you to give a presentation on Zoom detailing your responses to several pre prepared questions. This was followed by follow up questions. Did not advance to second round.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience using technology in the classroom?

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brooklyn College
Interview Descriptions: It was very smooth. There were two people in the interview and they asked questions to get to know me and as more time passed they asked questions to learn more about my skills and time management.

title: Financial Aid Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brooklyn College
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy, very flexible. You will be mentored even if you know nothing about the job and they will make sure you are up to the task. Will also give you a tour.

title: Athletics and Recreation Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brooklyn College
Interview Descriptions: You will apply through their website for the job, after the time comes for the interview, they will call you and ask you for the convenient time that you can go for in person interview. After the interview date and time scheduled. you will go for the interview.

title: Student Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (Brooklyn, NY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: A 15 minute Zoom call. I was asked about my interest in the role, my course experience, my sense of reliability, how I would want to help students, my experiences tutoring.
Interview Questions: How would you help your students?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (Brooklyn, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews for this position; one by the department and the other by the college. The individuals were pleasant and personable, and made me feel at ease. I felt that the interviews were each an appropriate length of time to the tune of 30 minutes. In general it was a fair and validating interview process.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (Brooklyn, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward, common questions, show enthusiasm and interest. A lot of experience isn't required. I was a full-time student when I applied for the position so its great for students especially because your place of work and school is on one campus. It's not a difficult interview process.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have?

title: Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brooklyn College
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview first and then an in person interview. Interview in front of a group of staff members. There was a  written test at the end.  Took about a month and a half.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brooklyn College
Interview Descriptions: Quick turn around time, and warm faculty . I felt welcomed by the department and had a very pleasant interview experience. Facilities were a bit "run-down" and a lack of resources was communicated multiple times.

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (Brooklyn, NY) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Perfect. Brief, good questions, friendly, flexible in time scheduling, exactly the way I would have wanted it. Left with good feeling about my prospective colleagues and teaching there.  I was looking forward to joining at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: Are you ok with low compensation?

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (New York, NY) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: face to face interview and technical test. They have contacted me and ask me come in person for interview and they gave a sheet of questions and ask me to solve this

title: College Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Brooklyn College
Interview Descriptions: easy going, people in the department are all friendly, you get to learn the basics flow of the department and get to engage with everyone including the professors in the department

title: Foundation Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (New York, NY) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very easy,they call first  and tell you you've been considered.Then you get another callback a few days later about you're availability on which days to work.Very nice people in the interviewing process.

title: Recreation Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (Brooklyn, NY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview if you're a student and if you have the time. The hours are a set schedule so if your schedule match the recreation hours, you're likely to get hired. Just be friendly and courteous.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (Brooklyn, NY) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quick since I was fully prepared with a copy of my resume. I was waiting outside the office when I was called into the office ot accept an on-the-spot interview. Greeted normally and the employer asked for my employment history and education background.
Interview Questions: Do you have prior experiences? Describe your work environment.

title: Web Developer/Student Aid Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Brooklyn College in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I responded to an email that was sent to a school mailing list. I spoke to someone on the phone for a few minutes and we arranged a time for me to come in. He gave me a brief written test that included JS, jQuery, SQL, PHP and regular expressions.
He reviewed my answers and he told me that he sees the ones that I got right and he was impressed, but he wanted to discuss the ones that I got wrong. A bunch of my mistakes were because I was unfamiliar with the syntax and he was OK with that as long as I knew what the idea was.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between an INNER JOIN and an OUTER JOIN?

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (Brooklyn, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with the director of the program and was interviewed, she wanted to know what I've done at the college and my background. I was hired shortly after. The overall experience after the interview took about two week.s

title: Phonathon Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (Brooklyn, NY) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Got contacted via e-mail by the Brooklyn College career center. After I filled out an online application, I had a brief phone interview with a Brooklyn Foundation representative. The day after the interview I received an e-mail, informing me that I was hired. The training session took place a few days after I received the confirmation e-mail.
Interview Questions: Name two reasons why you are a good fit for the job?

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (Brooklyn, NY) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: As long as you are a student there it is a relatively painless process. First you have to find a professor to be your mentor. Said professor has to have a project for you or you can suggest a project of your own. If the professor has a work and a budget for you, you're hired!

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brooklyn College
Interview Descriptions:
Under supervision, performs miscellaneous clerical, administrative, research or other work related to the operation of a College or other unit where such work is required on a part-time basis or for a period of limited duration.

There is one Assignment Level for this position. All personnel perform related work. This specification describes typical assignments; related duties may be assigned as needed. Maximum tenure for any employee in this hourly position is 1040 hours per year.

title: FULL PROFESSOR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 10 months. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (Brooklyn, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by all day campus interview

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (Brooklyn, NY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the manager and he basically hired me after getting approval from his bosses. My availability was a huge factor in me getting hired. They are also looking for people with good customer service skills and patience,

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brooklyn College
Interview Descriptions: Computer literacy test and why work for them.

title: Adjunct Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brooklyn College
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring process was not particularly complex. 

After speaking with the department head I was asked to give a sample lecture in front of several of the department chair persons. During the practice lecture several questions were asked regarding the lecture that made me go into further detail about several topics.
Interview Questions: Explain a certain part of the lecture in more detail (was difficult because this was an algebra lecture and I was being asked basic algebraic questions from Math PhDs).

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (Brooklyn, NY) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very easy. Just checked your basic computer skills. They don't ask isyour good with people or even know the alphabet. I would think that would be important since you deal with students and filing all day long. I applied within the school and got a call about three days later from about three different offices.
Interview Questions: None they were all ridiculously easy.

title: Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (Brooklyn, NY) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very easy.  I applied through work study, which once you are eligible call you in for a meeting to set up paper work. They give you the option of working on or off campus.  If there is anything available you are going to be starting within the next week.  All they really care about knowing is you major to make sure you are going to be set up with the right job.  They then asked for your availability and if they liked you, you got the job

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (New York, NY) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a standard process: job talk but did not include teaching observation as it does at many schools. Began with a phone interview and then it involved an interview with the search committee of the department. They asked me to give a "job talk" on a topic of my choice.
Interview Questions: Tell us why you are the best person for this position.

title: Blogger Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (New York, NY) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: in person interview ,asked a series of questions along with in depth previous experience. During the interview process interviewer recorded the interview. After the interview was over I waited 2 days to hear an answer back from them
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (Brooklyn, NY) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: express what it is you want to achieve in business. the ask me what my goals were and how would i go about achieving them in life. the are a great community of people.

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Brooklyn College (Brooklyn, NY) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Submitted curriculum vita and cover letter; participated in phone interview, and then a personal interview with department chair.
Interview Questions: Questions were standard fare: teaching philosophy and style, how to handle difficult students;  relations with administrators, etc.
